entry.title: Exchange Hotel, Montgomery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Exchange Hotel, Montgomery (pictured), where Confederate president Jefferson Davis's inaugural procession started, also hosted Ku Klux Klan leaders, politicians, prostitutes, and two US presidents?

entry.title: coastal aquifer system (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the groundwater level of a coastal aquifer system changes with the tide?

entry.title: Simon Groot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that agronomist Simon Groot was awarded the 2019 World Food Prize for giving hundreds of millions of people access to nutritious vegetables?

entry.title: Giant Drop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 144 couples were pronounced man and wife on the Giant Drop before the cars at the top were released 205 feet (62 m) down?

entry.title: Şeyhmus Erdinç (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as a child, Turkey national amputee footballer Şeyhmus Erdinç played football with balls he made out of crumpled paper?

entry.title: Yale Club of New York City Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when the Yale Club of New York City Building was completed in 1901, a Yale Club member said "it will be an easy matter to look down upon" the Harvard Club?

entry.title: Christian Lamb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at 102 years old, Christian Lamb is one of the last surviving officers of the Women's Royal Naval Service who served throughout World War II?

entry.title: Yes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that given a choice between Life and World, the answer was Yes?
